oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Electromagnetic Transition Strengths for Light Nuclei in the Skyrme model
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Haberichter, M.
Lau, P. H. C.
Manton, N. S.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Nuclear Theory
High Energy Physics - Theory
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We calculate reduced $B(E2)$ electromagnetic transition strengths for light nuclei of mass numbers $B=8,12,16,20,24$ and $32$ within the Skyrme model. We find that the predicted transition strengths are of the correct order of magnitude and the computed intrinsic quadrupole moments match the experimentally observed effective nuclear shapes. For the Hoyle state we predict a large $B(E2)\!\uparrow$ value of $0.0521\, \rm{e}^2\rm{b}^2$. For Oxygen-16, we can obtain a quantitative understanding of the ground state rotational band and the rotational excitations of the second spin-0 state, $0_2^+$.
Comment: 23 pages, 2 figures; updated to match published version in Phys. Rev. C
